alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Western Essex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:23PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL CAROLINE AND NORTHWESTERN ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 223 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ladysmith, or near Milford, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bowling Green and Milford around 230 PM EDT. Fort A.p. Hill around 240 PM EDT. Port Royal around 255 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rappahannock Academy, Golansville, Villboro, Supply, Ruther Glen, Woodford, and Penola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
